title: Using the new client slows my entire system down and my game lags.
body: Tried the new client a few times, but I can't even play a game because it raises the ping and slows my entire system down when I only launch it. Is anyone else having this problem?

replies.body:
Heyo!  You should be able to launch the client in '**low spec mode**' which should reduce your computer resources used significantly.  Additionally, if you are having trouble in-game, you can turn on the '**close the client in game**' toggle in settings.  This will close the league client UX process during the game completely.  

After the game ends, it will re-initialize back to the end of game screen and pick up where you left off :)

Let me know if that doesn't help!

Is it actually possible to have the client relaunch after the nexus gets destroyed, instead of upon clicking "ok"?

The relaunch is so slow and is the only thing I'm hating in the new client.

> [{quoted}](name=Kei143,realm=NA,application-id=2E4zVIwd,discussion-id=axJgacml,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2017-04-13T19:48:32.354+0000)
>
> Is it actually possible to have the client relaunch after the nexus gets destroyed, instead of upon clicking "ok"?
> 
> The relaunch is so slow and is the only thing I'm hating in the new client.

So if you uncheck "close the client in game" it should launch quickly after game ends.  If this isn't something you want to do, there's unfortunately a small trade-off that requires the client to wait until game is closed before it launches.

It's technically doing its prep work as soon as game ends, but won't show itself until you click OK to avoid soaking up CPU on closing the game client.  We've been working on a smoother way to handle this, but it's not quite there yet.
